module.name: physical_layout_template
module.keywords: module, template, layout, connection zone, reference

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information needed to describe a template, a layout template and referense assignments of these templates. A template is a kind of product that can be physicaly realised but typically can not be produced or bought independently but only as a direct or indirect component of a an assembly of a part. A layout template is a template that is a collector for shape data templates for layout items.

inscope.li: identification of a template, it's version and definition;
identification of a definition of a layout template;
identification of a connection zone in a layout template;
identification of a association between functional unit and template for reference purpose;
identification of a association between analytical representation and template for reference purpose;
identification of a connection zone in layout template;
items within the scope of application module Analytical model, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1603;
items within the scope of application module Characteristic, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1654;
items within the scope of application module Feature and connection zone, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1671;
items within the scope of application module Functional decomposition to design, ISO/CD-TS 10303-1676;
items within the scope of application module Part and version identification, ISO/TS 10303-1022;
items within the scope of application module Part view definition, ISO/TS 10303-1023;
items within the scope of application module Shape property assignment, ISO/TS 10303-1032.
